intro: Amalia anceps, commonly known as the white-flowered bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features showy, bell-shaped white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks. Amalia anceps is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
